adjectives.description: myogenic (comparative more myogenic, superlative most myogenic)

entries.meaning: (embryology) Forming muscle fibres; pertaining to myogenesis. [from 19th c.]
(physiology, medicine) Originating in muscle tissue; specifically, pertaining to contractile activity that is produced by the muscles independent of any neural mechanism. [from 19th c.]
examples: Gaskell, using frogs' hearts, proved that the heartbeat was, as Haller had suggested, of myogenic origin.
